thread.title: Pace of Disarmament Stands as Major Obstacle in North Korea Talks

author: Andrew Jeong
title: Pace of Disarmament Stands as Major Obstacle in North Korea Talks
text:
SEOUL—South Korea warned of big differences between the U.S. and North Korean positions on denuclearization, highlighting the difficulty of reaching a deal as both sides continued talks aimed at halting the threat from Pyongyang’s nuclear weapons.
With less than two weeks until a planned summit in Singapore between President Donald Trump and North Korean leader Kim Jong Un, U.S. and North Korean officials have been trying to agree on terms under which Pyongyang would relinquish its nuclear arsenal in exchange for security... RELATED VIDEO Can the Trump-Kim Summit Really Happen? A series of twists ahead of a possible June 12 summit between President Donald Trump and North Korea's Kim Jong Un suggest that, despite showcased optimism, the two leaders are struggling to find common ground on key issues such as denuclearization.
